column2: CHAPTER XXXIV
column3: CHAPTER thirty four

column2: It was the wedding-day of four happy people.
column3: It was the wedding day of four happy people.

column2: The day was bright, the sky blue, and Sherwood had taken upon itself early summer raiment.
column3: The day was bright, the sky blue, and Sherwood had taken upon itself early summer raiment.

column2: The old church of Nottingham was already crowded to excess.
column3: The old church of Nottingham was already crowded to excess.

column2: Richard meant to employ these fellows shrewdly and test their loyalty.
column3: Richard meant to employ these fellows shrewdly and test their loyalty.

column2: The hour was reached, and at once a small company was seen issuing forth from Nottingham Castle.
column3: The hour was reached, and at once a small company was seen issuing forth from Nottingham Castle.

column2: Arthur-a-Bland, with a gold chain about his neck, given him by the knight Sir Richard, walked with Middle the Tinker on his left and Much the Miller on his right.
column3: Arthur a Bland, with a gold chain about his neck, given him by the knight Sir Richard, walked with Middle the Tinker on his left and Much the Miller on his right.

column2: They came to the lych gate, and the crowd jostled itself in its admiration.
column3: They came to the lych gate, and the crowd jostled itself in its admiration.

column2: As they walked, rather consciously, up the narrow path between the smiling ranks of their fellows the crowd cheered them radiantly.
column3: As they walked, rather consciously, up the narrow path between the smiling ranks of their fellows the crowd cheered them radiantly.

column2: For Robin Hood and Will Scarlett the Bishop had enmity and contempt, but towards the Earls of Huntingdon and Nottingham this time-serving man could only profess an abundance of respect.
column3: For Robin Hood and Will Scarlett the Bishop had enmity and contempt, but towards the Earls of Huntingdon and Nottingham this time serving man could only profess an abundance of respect.

column2: The brides were to be escorted from Gamewell by no other person than the King himself.
column3: The brides were to be escorted from Gamewell by no other person than the King himself.

column2: He was to give them both in marriage, and had promised them jewels and to spare when they were come to Court.
column3: He was to give them both in marriage, and had promised them jewels and to spare when they were come to Court.

column2: The people were wild with joy at having their King amongst them like this.
column3: The people were wild with joy at having their King amongst them like this.

column2: As the King jumped down from his horse before the lych gate, and held out his strong hand to help the brides from off their milk-white mares, the whole place became alive with excitement and rapture.
column3: As the King jumped down from his horse before the lych gate, and held out his strong hand to help the brides from off their milk white mares, the whole place became alive with excitement and rapture.

column2: Little maids, with baskets of violets and primroses, flung their offerings prettily under the feet of the two beauteous blushing brides, who leaned so timidly upon the King's proud arms.
column3: Little maids, with baskets of violets and primroses, flung their offerings prettily under the feet of the two beauteous blushing brides, who leaned so timidly upon the King's proud arms.

column2: The Bishop had spoken the Latin service impressively and with unction.
column3: The Bishop had spoken the Latin service impressively and with unction.

column2: In the first row stood Monceux, in all the pomp of his shrievalty, with his councilmen and aldermen.
column3: In the first row stood Monceux, in all the pomp of his shrievalty, with his councilmen and aldermen.

column2: Master Simeon, with face leaner than ever and inturning eyes, glared impotently at the chief actors in this historic scene.
column3: Master Simeon, with face leaner than ever and inturning eyes, glared impotently at the chief actors in this historic scene.

column2: But now that the double marriage was nearly made she suddenly appeared, thrusting her way rudely through the gathered crowd at the church door.
column3: But now that the double marriage was nearly made she suddenly appeared, thrusting her way rudely through the gathered crowd at the church door.

column2: She was wild-eyed, dishevelled, her dress fastened all awry.
column3: She was wild eyed, dishevelled, her dress fastened all awry.

column2: Folks looked once at her, and then exchanged glances between themselves.
column3: Folks looked once at her, and then exchanged glances between themselves.

column2: Stay this mockery of marriage, my lord, she cried, fiercely facing the Bishop.
column3: Stay this mockery of marriage, my lord, she cried, fiercely facing the Bishop.

column2: Is no crime too great for you?"
column3: Is no crime too great for you?"

column2: Seize this woman, some of you, and take her without. I will deal with her later." He imperiously signed to his guards, and at once the demoiselle was gripped harshly by both arms.
column3: Seize this woman, some of you, and take her without. I will deal with her later." He imperiously signed to his guards, and at once the demoiselle was gripped harshly by both arms.

column2: At the door of the church she turned once as though to renew her preposterous charges, but contented herself merely with a single glance towards them of malignant hate.
column3: At the door of the church she turned once as though to renew her preposterous charges, but contented herself merely with a single glance towards them of malignant hate.

column2: Then she was gone; and people stirred themselves uneasily, as folks do when having been within touch of the plague.
column3: Then she was gone; and people stirred themselves uneasily, as folks do when having been within touch of the plague.

column2: When he saw that she was gone, that the dreadful episode was done, he gasped hurriedly and sat down.
column3: When he saw that she was gone, that the dreadful episode was done, he gasped hurriedly and sat down.

column2: Then all signed their names in the church books, and the trumpeters and heralds made music for them.
column3: Then all signed their names in the church books, and the trumpeters and heralds made music for them.

column2: They returned through the streets of Nottingham, gay now with flags and merry with a joyful populace.
column3: They returned through the streets of Nottingham, gay now with flags and merry with a joyful populace.

column2: All the treasure that they had accumulated in their caves at Barnesdale the King's bowmen freely distributed this day.
column3: All the treasure that they had accumulated in their caves at Barnesdale the King's bowmen freely distributed this day.

column2: All were happy--the nightmare of unjust dealings, of Norman oppression, of laws for the poor and none for the rich, was ended.
column3: All were happy-the nightmare of unjust dealings, of Norman oppression, of laws for the poor and none for the rich, was ended.

column2: The King had said it, and the King had already made good the promise in his words.
column3: The King had said it, and the King had already made good the promise in his words.

column2: Sir Richard of the Lee and his son became members of the Star Chamber, with grants of land in perpetuity.
column3: Sir Richard of the Lee and his son became members of the Star Chamber, with grants of land in perpetuity.

column2: Turning to Marian, the King wished her every joy that she could wish herself, and gave to her the lands of Broadweald in Lancashire to hold in her own right for ever.
column3: Turning to Marian, the King wished her every joy that she could wish herself, and gave to her the lands of Broadweald in Lancashire to hold in her own right for ever.

column2: Thus you shall have wealth to share with your Robin; and I counsel you both to make good use of your days.	Thus you shall have wealth to share with your Robin; and I counsel you both to make good use of your days.
My subjects who are loyal to me shall have no cause to regret it.
column3: My subjects who are loyal to me shall have no cause to regret it.

column2: Help her to administer her riches, Geoffrey, wisely and well; and be you all ready when I shall call upon you.
column3: Help her to administer her riches, Geoffrey, wisely and well; and be you all ready when I shall call upon you.
